articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: President Donald Trump told Reuters in a phone interview on Friday that he and his team knew everything about Israel's plan to attack Iran and that he had given Tehran fair warning it needed to make a deal on its nuclear program.
articles.title: 'We knew everything,' Trump tells Reuters about Israel's strikes on Iran

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel said early on Friday that it struck Iran, and Iranian media said explosions were heard in Tehran as tensions mounted over U.S. efforts to win Iran's agreement to halt production of material for an atomic bomb.
articles.title: Israel says it strikes Iran amid nuclear tensions

articles.author: Sudipto Ganguly, Abhijith Ganapavaram, Sumit Khanna
articles.description: Rescue workers searched for missing people and aircraft parts on Friday after an Air India plane crashed onto a medical college hostel in the city of Ahmedabad, killing more than 240 people in the world's worst aviation disaster in a decade.
articles.title: Rescuers search for missing people, aircraft parts after Air India crash kills over 240

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump can keep his deployment of National Guard troops in Los Angeles, according to a court ruling, as protests against immigration raids look set to enter their second week in the strongest backlash since his return to power in January.
articles.title: Trump allowed to keep National Guard in Los Angeles as more protests planned

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israel sent Mossad commandos deep into Iran to destroy Iranian weapons systems during Israel's attack on nuclear and military targets, an Israeli security source said, while another official said Israel used a ploy to suggest the strike was not imminent.
articles.title: Israel used long-planned subterfuge in attack on Iranian nuclear targets, Israeli sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Friday it had conducted large-scale tests of new laser-based systems to defend against drones.
articles.title: Russia says it tests new laser defences against drones

articles.author: Lisa Barrington, Joanna Plucinska
articles.description: Airlines steered clear of much of the Middle East on Friday after Israeli attacks on Iranian sites forced carriers to cancel or divert thousands of flights in the latest upheaval to travel in the region.
articles.title: Middle East airspace shut after Israel strikes Iran, airlines cancel flights

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte has petitioned the International Criminal Court to allow his interim release to another country, his lawyer said in a filing, citing his advanced age and a vow not to flee or commit any crimes.
articles.title: Philippines' Duterte seeks interim ICC release to undisclosed country

articles.author: Leila  Miller
articles.description: Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner, Argentina's leading opposition leader and a two-time former president, has petitioned a lower court to allow her to serve a sentence for corruption under house arrest, citing how several years ago she narrowly survived an assassination attempt.
articles.title: Argentina's Kirchner asks court to avoid jail time, citing assassination risk

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnam has been formally admitted as a "partner country" of the BRICS group of major emerging economies, Brazil's government said on Friday, as the bloc presses ahead with an expansion push.
articles.title: Vietnam admitted as BRICS 'partner country,' Brazil says
